sen.j: 成人の日（せいじんのひ）は日本の国民の祝日の1日である。
sen.e: Coming-of-Age Day is one of Japanese national holidays.

sen.j: 国民の祝日に関する法律（祝日法）では「おとなになったことを自覚し、みずから生き抜こうとする青年を祝いはげます」ことを趣旨としている。
sen.e: Act on National Holidays states the purpose of the holiday is "to celebrate and encourage young people who realize they have grown up and try to live a life by themselves".

sen.j: この日には、各市町村で新成年を招いて成人式が行われる（ただし、豪雪の影響や帰省しやすい時期等を考慮してゴールデンウィークや盆に行われる地方も多い）。
sen.e: On this holiday each city and town invite new grownups to held a Coming of Age ceremony (in some regions it is held during the Golden Week (early-May holiday season) or Bon festival (a festival of the Dear or Buddhist All Souls' Day) considering influence of heavy snow and season when one can return to hometown).

On this holiday each city and town invites those people who have turned twenty in the last year to a Coming of Age ceremony (in some regions it is held during Golden Week, a holiday in early-May, or during the Bon festival, the festival of Buddhist All Souls' Day, in order to avoid heavy snow and for it to be during a time when people can return to their birthplace).

sen.e: Essentially Coming-of-Age Day is for those who turn twenty on the next day of the last Coming-of-Age Day to the day of present one (ex. For the Coming-of-Age Day of 1998, those who turn twenty from 16 January 1997 to 15 January 1998).
